actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for 10:00 a.m. on December 13, 2023.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Kiley moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by recorded vote: 218
On motion to recommit Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 206

actions-list.actionItem: Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 357 — "To require the head of an agency to issue and sign any rule issued by that agency, and for other purposes."
The Chair announced that the unfinished business was the question on the motion to recommit to H.R. 357 and passage of H.R. 357, if ordered.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of December 12.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

At the conclusion of debate on H.R. 357, the Chair put the question on the motion to recommit and by voice vote, announced that the noes prevailed. Mr. Mrvan demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The previous question on the motion to recommit was ordered pursuant to clause 2(b) of rule XIX.
Mr. Mrvan moved to recommit to the Committee on the Judiciary.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.R. 357.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 1147 and H.R. 357. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 1147 under a structured rule with one hour of general debate and H.R. 357 under a closed rule with one hour of general debate. The resolution provides for a motion to recommit on both measures. It also provides that on any legislative day of the second session of the 118th Congress before January 9, 2024, the Speaker may dispense with organizational and legislative business and that the Journal of the proceedings of the previous day shall be considered as approved if applicable.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 922. H.R. 357 — "To require the head of an agency to issue and sign any rule issued by that agency, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 386
actions-list.actionItem: 37 (Roll no. 715).
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 4531 — "To reauthorize certain programs that provide for opioid use disorder prevention, recovery, and treatment, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 396
actions-list.actionItem: 28 (Roll no. 714).
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 5524 — "To amend the start date of the pilot program on sharing with foreign branches, subsidiaries and affiliates."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 420
actions-list.actionItem: 1 (Roll no. 713).

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 5119 — "To amend title 31, United States Code, to provide small businesses with additional time to file beneficial ownership information, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 403
actions-list.actionItem: 20 (Roll no. 712).
Considered as unfinished business. S. 788 — "To amend the Permanent Electronic Duck Stamp Act of 2013 to allow States to issue fully electronic stamps under that Act, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 215
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 216

actions-list.actionItem: Considered as unfinished business. H. Res. 922 — "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1147) to amend the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act to allow schools that participate in the school lunch program under such Act to serve whole milk; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 357) to require the head of an agency to issue and sign any rule issued by that agency, and for other purposes; and for other purposes."

The Chair announced that the unfinished business was the question on ordering the previous question on H. Res. 922; on agreeing to the resolution, if ordered; and on the motions to suspend the rules; which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of December 12.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 922, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Scanlon demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 922.

Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 922 — "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1147) to amend the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act to allow schools that participate in the school lunch program under such Act to serve whole milk; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 357) to require the head of an agency to issue and sign any rule issued by that agency, and for other purposes; and for other purposes."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Krishnamoorthi to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal. Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of December 12.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable David Kustoff to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
